sections.purpose: To store temperature-sensitive drugs, reagents, and biological samples at 2–8°C.
sections.scope: Applicable to cold storage requirements in Pharmacology and animal facilities.
procedure: Verify that the temperature display is within the 2–8°C range.
Arrange items to allow free air circulation and avoid blocking vents.
Label all stored materials with name, concentration, date of receipt/preparation, and expiry.
Record temperature at least once daily in the logbook.
Clean shelves and interior surfaces regularly with approved disinfectant.
Defrost the unit if ice buildup affects efficiency.
Remove expired or unused items promptly according to disposal SOPs.
precautions: Do not store food, drink, or non-laboratory items.
Minimize door openings to maintain temperature stability.
Avoid storing flammable solvents unless the refrigerator is explosion-proof.
Ensure connection to a stable or backup power supply for critical items.
Check the door gasket periodically for damage and proper sealing.
